dict.string: Here you can buy a lot of cute stuffed animals and other souvenirs with animal themes. It's close to the entrance of Seoul Grand Park, right next to the subway station exit.
Close to Seoul Grand Park Station, Exit 2

You can ride the elephant train to get here from the Seoul Grand Park entrance. A one-way ticket on the elephant train is 1000 KRW. It's a 10-20 minute walk if you decide not to ride the elephant train.
This is one of the first animal exhibits upon entering zoo. Try to come in an afternoon when the weather is good so you get to see the animals.
This is one of the first animal exhibits upon entering zoo. Try to come in an afternoon when the weather is good so you get to see the animals.
This is also one of the first animal exhibits upon entering zoo. Try to come in an afternoon when the weather is good so you get to see the animals.
This is also one of the first animal exhibits upon entering zoo. Try to come in an afternoon when the weather is good so you get to see the animals.
The zoo is divided into several sections, each of which features different animal exhibits and viewing area. Don't miss out on some of the indoor exhibits and education centers as well.
The rhinocerous may or may not be out depending on weather conditions and other factors.
This indoor museum/exhibit features models, displays, exhibits, and live insects as well. (Don't worry, they are safely locked inside glass display boxes).
The Asiatic water buffalo, Asian elephant, and White rhinoceros are grouped together in close proximity. If one is not in the mood to be seen, try your luck with the other ones!
If you are tired from watching so many animals, stop here to rest and get something to eat.
If you are tired from watching so many animals, stop here to rest and get something to eat.
If you are tired from watching so many animals, stop here to rest and get something to eat.
The dromedary and bactrian camel are close to each other. Don't miss out!
The dromedary and bactrian camel are close to each other. Don't miss out!
The horses are close to the camel exhibit. Be sure to come when weather conditions are right, so you can see the animals out in all their glory.
Dall's Sheep is a sweet and gentle creature, don't forget to give them attention in your rush to see the tigers and elephants.
An indoor aquarium with exhbitis for dolphins, seals, and sea lions. It's usually open, but may be closed for construction.
The California sea lion, Jackass Penguin, and Harbor seal are grouped togeher in a common viewing area and part of the Dolphin Encounters complex.
The condor, eagle, and vulture and grouped together in a common viewing area, each species in its own separate cage.
Guanacao is better known as a lama and is indigenous to South America. He's here in Korea just for you!
The botanical gardens are right across from the Lion enclosure and under the ski lift.
The lion cafe is entered by walking down a staircase. It is a cafe literally inside the Lion encosure, so you can enjoy a meal and check out the lions from inside a glass-encased viewing area.
The Lion enclosure is one of the highlights of the zoo. If you come during feeding time, you'll see the lions eagerly catch pieces of raw chicken and meat like a dog grabs a frisbee.
This convenience store is right across from the Lion enclosure. Stop and go inside for a cool drink if you need a break.
The ape jungle tour is a series of exhibits featuring apes, gorillas, chimps, and other related animals.
The baobab tree is model tree close to the zoo entrance. You can climb to the top and enjoy a nice view of some of the surrounding exhibits.

Seoulland is an amusement park with fun rides and roller coasters. You can get there by elephant train. Admission for 1 adult is 40,000 KRW, with discounts for children, seniors, and if you are visiting at night.
The black bear exhibit has outdoor sections as well as semi-indoor sections with glass barriers and informational displays.
Close to the black bear exhibit, the conservation education center is a nice education area about conservation and the zoo animals in general.
One of the star attractions of the zoo, the tiger exhibit is a must-see!
Across from the tiger and leopard viewing area, the food court and CU convenience store offer good rest areas and stopping points.
Food Court and CU Convenience Store
The leopard exhibit is slightly elevated and alternates between outdoor viewing and semi-indoor (i.e. behind glass separator) display areas.
From South American llamas to African elephants to Asian tigers, the American Bison proves thise zoo has got it all!
The lowland tapir is a pretty docile creature and can be viewed from pretty close. Don't miss out!
The red deer are usually out in large numbers in flocks, so they are fun to see together.
A display area with various fowl such as peacocks and other birds.
Part of the Asian Jungle complex, the crocodile is fun to watch from the overhead walkway. It can also be viewed from a lower elevation.
The Asian jungle complex features snakes, crocodiles, and various reptiles, with indoor and outdoors exhibits.
